poem:
**The First Stroke**

In St Ives, where light is a thin violin,  
I wade into the world of color,  
my canvas as blank as a morning sky.  
A brush dips into oceans of blue,  
and with every stroke, a whisper of self—  
I feel the timid breath of the artist  
hovering somewhere behind my shoulder.
